title: A co-harmonic gyro-monotron with a novel corrugated interaction region
description: This was the first academic poster presentation I ever gave at the 2009 IET High Power RF Technologies Seminar.

title: A co-harmonic gyro-oscillator with a novel interaction region
venue: Pontifical University of St. Thomas Aquinas
description: This was the first international conference I ever attended - the 2009 International Vacuum Electronics Conference!

title: Recent progress on a co-harmonic gyrotron
description: This talk focussed on efforts to contain the driving signal within the co-harmonic interaction region - 2011 International Vacuum Electronics Conference.

title: Modelling of magnetosphere-ionosphere coupling at Earth (and eventually, in the Jovian system)
description: This talk gave an overview of the Vlasov model, with a focus on the previous examination of the terrestrial magnetosphere; at the Uniting Planetary Models and Data Analysis Tools/Services: A Europlanet NA Workshop.

title: High efficiency klystron development for particle accelerators
description: This talk gave an overview of the work done by the HEIKA collaboration; at the 58<sup>th</sup> ICFA Advanced Beam Dynamics Workshop on High Luminosity Circular e+e- Colliders (eeFACT'16).

title: Numerical simulation of high efficiency multiple beam klystrons
description: This talk gave an introduction to early MBK simulations; at the Tech-X User Group Meeting.

title: A novel co-harmonic gyrotron  Poster  2009-NVEC Cockcroft Institute 2009-09-09  Daresbury, United Kingdom http://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/a-novel-coharmonic-gyrotron(21f518b8-25d2-4ea6-8d69-6979f74a6b6f)/export.html  Poster presented at NVEC 2009.

A novel co-harmonic gyrotron  Talk  2009-UCMMT  Rutherford Appleton Laboratory  2009-10-19  Didcot, United Kingdom    This talk discussed numerical results from MAGIC3-D of the single cavity co-harmonic gyrotron.

Components for the testing of a co-harmonic gyrotron  Poster  2010-NVEC Cockcroft Institute 2010-07-14  Daresbury, United Kingdom http://indico.hep.manchester.ac.uk/conferenceDisplay.py?ovw=True&confId=2288  This poster gave an overview of the design and expected performance of components for testing the single cavity gyro-multiplier.
